page.title: 07Changing Times
page.content: THE AREA SINCE V.E. DAY On V.E. Day 1945 there were lots of street parties to celebrate the end of the War. However at that time most of the land in this area was used for farming and Byfleet and New Haw were only small village-like communities. There were only a few cars as most people travelled by bicycle and public transport. The largest company was Vickers Armstrong which has since become B.A.E. There was no library and less variety of entertainment than now available. People alive then can remember rationing of food, clothing and petrol. However, most people who we interviewed thought that although life had become easier and more comfortable, the area was less pleasant to live in because of traffic, pollution and vandalism.
